name: washing, drying and finishing laundry | washing, drying and finishing laundry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19532/documentation

This dataset represents the service of washing, drying, and finishing (including ironing) of laundry in low capacity professional laundries—capacity ;range of  300–500 kg of laundry per shift (8 h).;The capacity of such laundry services is typically between 8 to 12 kg per batch. Flat linen is ironed employing cylinder-heated ironers, garments were assumed to be ironed using ironing presses. Small-scale laundries iron linen manually. ;The dataset includes the infrastructure (washing machine and dryer, building infrastructure) required for the operation of the laundry service, and includes all the inputs (water, electrical and thermal energy, cleaning detergent) required to perform the service of laundry.  The dataset is modelled as a service dataset-the input and output of laundry is excluded from the scope.

From receving the laundry at the laundry service. The activity models the service of washing, drying and finishing 1 kg of laundry, it therefore includes the energy, water, detergent and infrastructure required per reference product. Because the activity is a service, the input of laundry is not included. 1 kg of this service should be used together with 1 kg of laundry (i.e. an input of linen) to be washed.

This activity includes the cleaning, drying and ironing of laundry.
category: S:Other service activities/96:Other personal service activities/960:Other personal service activities/9601:Washing and (dry-) cleaning of textile and fur products

processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Data on average water and enegy consumption, as well as the size of wash load per washing cycle has been taken from Máša, V., Bobák, P., Kuba, P., & Stehlík, P. (2013). Analysis of energy efficient and environmentally friendly technologies in professional laundry service. Clean Technologies and Environmental Policy, 15(3), 445-457.
The composition of waste water was assumed as a generic waste water. 
Data on average detergent use was estimated based on average supplier data.

flow.name: washing, drying and finishing laundry
flow.category: S:Other service activities/96:Other personal service activities/960:Other personal service activities/9601:Washing and (dry-) cleaning of textile and fur products

exchanges.description: According to "Máša el at (2013),, the average heat energy consumption (kWh) per kg of  laundry is 0.91 kWh. This is equivalent to 3.276 MJ.

exchanges.description: Considering an average lifetime of 10 years per washing machine, 250 working days per year, and 500 kg of laundry daily capacity, the average contribution of washing machine per kg washed laundry is calculated as 1/ [10 (years) * 250 (days per year) * 500 (kg/day) ] = 8.00E-07

exchanges.description: According to "Máša, V., Bobák, P., Kuba, P., & Stehlík, P. (2013). Analysis of energy efficient and environmentally friendly technologies in professional laundry service. Clean Technologies and Environmental Policy, 15(3), 445-457", the average electrical energy (kWh) consumption per kg washed, dryed, and ironed laundry is 0.15 kWh. This includes the total electricty consumption during the different stages of the  process.

exchanges.description: Considering a 100 square meter laundry service station, an average lifetime of 50 years per building hall, 250 working days per year, and 500 kg of laundry daily capacity, the average contribution of building hall per kg washed and dryed laundry is calculated as 100 (m2) / [50 (years)  * 250 (days / year) * 500 (kg/day) ] = 1.60E-05

exchanges.description: According to "Máša, V., Bobák, P., Kuba, P., & Stehlík, P. (2013). Analysis of energy efficient and environmentally friendly technologies in professional laundry service. Clean Technologies and Environmental Policy, 15(3), 445-457", the average waste water production per kg washed and dryed laundry is 12.5 kg, Considering a loss rate of 4% in the form of steam, the average water consumption per kg of laundry is calculated as 13 kg or 13 L.

exchanges.description: considering 4% of water loss to air

Estimated average amount of washing agent per wash cyle is 40 grams (based on average supplier data). Considering a load of 3.5 kg per wash cycle according to "Pakula, C., & Stamminger, R. (2010). Electricity and water consumption for laundry washing by washing machine worldwide. Energy Efficiency, 3(4), 365-382., Table 1",  the amount of washing agent per kg washed laundry is 40/3.5 = 11.42 g/kg washed Laundry or 0.011 kg/kg washed laundry.
